title: أَدَوَاتُ الشَّرْطِ الْمُتَقَدِّمَةُ
description: Learn about expanded conditional particles: لَمَّا الحينية، كُلَّمَا، أَيْنَ، أَنَّى، حَيْثُمَا، أَيَّانَ، مَهْمَا and their usage in classical Arabic.

notes.title: Review: Basic Conditional Particles
content: Conditional sentences in Arabic have two parts: جُمْلَة الشَّرْط (condition clause) and جَوَاب الشَّرْط (response clause). The basic conditional particles include إِنْ، إِذَا، مَنْ، مَا which can cause جَزْم (jussive) of the verbs.
Advanced conditional particles add nuances of time, place, manner, or repetition. Understanding these enhances comprehension of classical texts and Quranic Arabic.
keyPoints: Basic particles: إِنْ، إِذَا، مَنْ، مَا

examples.english: If you study, you will succeed (basic conditional)
Whoever does good will find it

examples.arabic: مَا تَفْعَلْ مِنْ خَيْرٍ يَعْلَمْهُ اللهُ
examples.english: Whatever good you do, Allah knows it
When Allah's victory comes

notes.title: لَمَّا الحينية (Temporal When)
content: لَمَّا الحينية (temporal لَمَّا) means 'when' indicating a specific time when an action occurred. It is followed by a past tense verb and introduces a realized condition - something that actually happened.
This is different from لَمَّا النافية (لَمَّا الجازمة) which means 'not yet' and causes جَزْم. لَمَّا الحينية is حَرْفُ وُجُودٍ لِوُجُودٍ (particle of existence for existence).

examples.english: When Zayd came, I honored him
When he came to them with truth, they said... (Quran)
When I saw him, I rejoiced
And when they opened their baggage, they found... (Quran 12:65)

notes.title: كُلَّمَا (Whenever)
content: كُلَّمَا means 'whenever' or 'every time that' - indicating repetition. It is ظَرْف زَمَان (adverb of time) and is followed by past tense verbs in both the condition and response.
It implies that the action happens repeatedly - each time the condition occurs, the response follows. It doesn't cause جَزْم.

examples.arabic: كُلَّمَا دَخَلَ عَلَيْهَا زَكَرِيَّا الْمِحْرَابَ وَجَدَ عِنْدَهَا رِزْقًا
examples.english: Whenever Zakariyya entered upon her in the prayer chamber, he found provision (Quran 3:37)

examples.arabic: كُلَّمَا أَرَادُوا أَنْ يَخْرُجُوا مِنْهَا أُعِيدُوا فِيهَا
examples.english: Whenever they want to exit from it, they are returned to it (Quran 32:20)
Whenever I visited him, he honored me
Whenever he read, he learned

notes.title: Place Conditional Particles
content: Several particles combine conditional meaning with place: أَيْنَ (where), أَنَّى (wherever/however), حَيْثُمَا (wherever). These indicate that the response applies in any place the condition is met.
These are أَسْمَاء شَرْط (conditional nouns) and typically cause جَزْم of both verbs when used conditionally.

examples.english: Wherever you may be, death will reach you (Quran 4:78)
Wherever he directs him, he brings no good (Quran 16:76)
However/wherever you wish (Quran 2:223)
Wherever you go, I will go

notes.title: أَيَّانَ (When - Future)
content: أَيَّان means 'when' but specifically for future or unknown time - often used in questions about the unknown future. It can be used conditionally or interrogatively.
In conditional use, it functions like مَتَى (when) but with a sense of uncertainty about the timing. It causes جَزْم when used conditionally.

examples.english: They ask you about the Hour: when will it arrive? (Quran 7:187)
When will they be resurrected? (Quran 16:21)
When is the Day of Judgment? (Quran 51:12)
Whenever you come, I will come to you

notes.title: مَهْمَا (Whatever/No Matter What)
content: مَهْمَا means 'whatever' or 'no matter what' - it covers any possible thing or action. It is اِسْم شَرْط جَازِم (conditional noun causing jussive) for non-rational entities.
It functions similarly to مَا الشرطية but with more emphasis on comprehensiveness - no matter what happens, the response applies. It causes جَزْم of both verbs.

examples.arabic: وَقَالُوا مَهْمَا تَأْتِنَا بِهِ مِنْ آيَةٍ لِتَسْحَرَنَا بِهَا فَمَا نَحْنُ لَكَ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
examples.english: They said: Whatever sign you bring us, we will not believe (Quran 7:132)
Whatever you do, I will do
No matter what the situation, be patient
Whatever you say, I won't change my opinion

exercises.prompt: لَمَّا جَاءَ زَيْدٌ أَكْرَمْتُهُ - لَمَّا هُنَا تَعْنِي _____ وَتُسَمَّى لَمَّا الْحِينِيَّة
exercises.promptEn: When Zayd came I honored him - لَمَّا here means _____ and is called temporal لَمَّا

exercises.prompt: كُلَّمَا تَدُلُّ عَلَى _____ - أَيْ أَنَّ الْفِعْلَ يَتَكَرَّرُ
exercises.promptEn: كُلَّمَا indicates _____ - meaning the action repeats

exercises.prompt: أَيْنَمَا تَكُونُوا يُدْرِكْكُمُ الْمَوْتُ - أَيْنَمَا أَدَاةُ شَرْطٍ تَدُلُّ عَلَى _____
exercises.promptEn: Wherever you are death reaches you - أَيْنَمَا is a conditional particle indicating _____

exercises.prompt: أَيَّانَ يُبْعَثُونَ - أَيَّانَ تَدُلُّ عَلَى _____ الْمُسْتَقْبَلِ الْمَجْهُولِ
exercises.promptEn: When will they be resurrected - أَيَّانَ indicates the _____ of the unknown future

exercises.prompt: مَهْمَا تَفْعَلْ أَفْعَلْ - مَهْمَا اسْمُ شَرْطٍ _____ لِلْفِعْلَيْنِ
exercises.promptEn: Whatever you do I do - مَهْمَا is a conditional noun that causes _____ for both verbs

exercises.prompt: كُلَّمَا دَخَلَ... وَجَدَ - كُلَّمَا ظَرْفٌ يَلِيهِ فِعْلٌ _____
exercises.promptEn: Whenever he entered... he found - كُلَّمَا is an adverb followed by a _____ verb

exercises.prompt: A conditional particle meaning 'wherever' relating to place
A particle asking about unknown future time ('when')
An adverb meaning 'whenever' indicating repeated occurrence
